p: Currently only two drugs are available for treatment: nifurtimox and benznidazole. Nifurtimox is no longer prescribed in many countries, such as Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, and USA, owing to reports of gastrointestinal effects, neurotoxicity, genotoxicity, and low efficacy against some T. cruzi strains. Benznidazole, 2-nitro- N-(phenylmetil)-1H-imidazole-1-acetamide, proved efficient in the initial period of the illness, but its efficacy in the chronic phase is controversial [ 84].
